page.title: 01BERKSWICH BLOCK REVIEW
page.content: Our block consists of an area just to the east of Berkswich School and positioned between two main road routes from Stafford to Rugeley and Stafford to Cannock.It has one small village called Brocton in which mainly professional people live and who commute to large towns nearby and in the West Midlands.The rest of the block is divided rougly equally between open heathland owned by Staffordshire County Council and the Forestry Commission with some fringe farm land around the edge. We have looked at the use of the land by man and its natural state.We have looked at Brocton and its village life and the attitudes of the people.We have included notes on various special features contained in the block and land owners and farming. (RB Berkswich)
